column4: What is the difference between "make clean" and "make distclean" ?
distclean will remove cache files etc... and will remove your makefile
it returns it to the state it was for distribution
brent113 so will using both make clean and make distclean equivalent to uninstall ?  i guess not ?
oh I thought brent113 meant that
make clean/distclean has nothing to do with any install binaries
btw I also went into the source folder and did make uninstall... and it displayed some code .. so has my previos pidgin version been uninstalled?
probably... if not... why do you care?
so u mean just continue running with the latest version whilst leavign the old one there?
the new one will have overwritten the old one
no it didnt , i used the /opt directory for the new one .. dunno where the old one was?
well just make sure you run the one from opt and you'll be fine... unless you're worried about hdd space
yeah i changed the path in applications to the new path
u mean i create my own .deb ?
and my .deb would remove the old version ?
if it was installed by a .deb yes
yeah i learnt it that one has to remember the location while installing for a good and efficient removal
